content.p: A rental service needs to purchase {{good}}s to be rented for the next 4 days. The demand for {{good}}s for these days are {{M1}}, {{M2}}, {{M3}}, {{M4}} each. It costs {{newcost}} credits to purchase them new. It costs {{slowcost}} credits to fix them up for use again after a full day of work. This can be speed up for {{fastcost}} credits to be ready the very next day. How many new {{good}}s should be purchased, and how many after each day should be fast fixed or slow fixed to minimize cost?

outtro.p: {{purchase}} {{good}}s should be purchased new. After the first day, {{day1fast}} should be fast fixed, and {{day1slow}} should be slow fixed. After the second day, {{day2fast}} should be fast fixed, and {{day2slow}} should be slow fixed. After the third day, {{day3fast}} should be fast fixed. This results in a minimal cost of {{optimalsolution}} credits.
